{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cribriform plate is part of the ethmoid bone and is located at the apex of the nasal cavities. It separates the nasal cavities below from the cranial cavity above. It supports the olfactory bulb and is perforated by olfactory foramina for the passage of olfactory nerves to the roof of the nasal cavity. Based on this information, the cribriform plate connects the nasal cavity and the anterior cranial fossa.", "answer_choice": "A"}
